column4: hello, I installed mozilla-imagezoom.  unfortunately it will not fully install or uninstall.  I am unable to use synaptic.
what would the options be on that command?
I'm not sure what you're asking
what kind of error message? Package unknown or the like?
usage: sudo -K | -L | -V | -h | -k | -l | -v usage: sudo [-HPSb]  [-p prompt]  [-u username|#uid]           { -e file [...]  | -i | -s | <command> }
you missed the most important thing: sudo dpkg --force-remove-rinstreq mozilla-imagezoom (the dpkg command)
ok, I'm a newb at this.
the dpkg command is the command that is doing something, and sudo just lets you do it with adminstrative privileges
$ sudo dpkg --force-remove-rinsteq mozilla-imagezoom dpkg: unknown force/refuse option `remove-rinsteq'
sorry to keep bothering you nickrud.  'dpkg:  need an action option'

np, I missed an option in the line I gave you (I don't have a package at hand to test this command on before giving it, sorry) sudo dpkg -r --force-remove-reinstreq mozilla-imagezoom (i missed the -r)
